Description: White steatite scarab: engraved on the base with a plant on the 'r' sign. There is a hole pierced through longitudinally. Chipped with small section missing from edge of base.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: The design may be a confusion of the sign for south, 'rsw', combining the plant of Lower Egypt with the 'r' sign. Cf. Newberry, 'Scarab-shaped seal' Pl. XII 37203; Rowe, 'A catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, scaraboids, seals and amulets : in the Palestine Archaeological Museum', 1936 Pl. XVI 619.
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.106, no.136)
Condition: Fair; chipped with small section missing from edge of base; abraded.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Bagshaw Museum and Art Gallery, Batley
